question: According to IUCN, what is the conservation status of the "Galapagos Sea Lion"?
explanation: According to the IUCN's Red List of Threatened Species, Galapagos Sea Lion is an endangered species of a sea lion. It is the most abundant marine mammal in the archipelago. It is a sea lion species that primarily breeds in the Galapagos Islands, although some breeding colonies also occur on Isla de la Plata just off mainland Ecuador. They are the smallest sea lion species and fairly social which make them welcoming party of the islands.
